avalancheActivity.comment:
The large quantity of fresh snow of Tuesday and very particularly the wind slabs can still be released in some cases, in particular at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example in particular at intermediate and high altitudes, and on very steep slopes above approximately 2200 m.
In some places the avalanches can be triggered in the weakly bonded old snow and reach quite a large size. Whumpfing sounds serve as an alarm indicating the danger. On very steep sunny slopes the likelihood of avalanches will increase during the day.
The current avalanche situation calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and caution. Several small and medium-sized slab avalanches have been released by people in the last few days.

On extremely steep sunny slopes small and medium-sized dry and moist snow slides are to be expected from the middle of the day, in particular at the base of rock walls, and in steep rocky terrain. Gliding avalanches are also to be expected at any time, in particular on extremely steep grassy slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: For those venturing off piste an unfavourable avalanche situation will persist in some regions.

snowpackStructure.comment:
40 to 80 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last seven days. The sometimes strong wind has transported some snow.
Several small and medium-sized slab avalanches have been released by people in the last few days.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2400 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitude a little snow is lying.

tendency.highlights: As the day progresses as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation there will be a gradual increase in the danger of moist snow slides.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of a moderate to strong wind from westerly directions, wind slabs formed on Wednesday. They are covered with new snow and therefore barely recognisable.
Little snow fell on Saturday. In addition mostly small wind slabs formed adjacent to ridgelines on west, northwest and north facing slopes and generally in the high Alpine regions. The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs can still be released, especially adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas, and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example, in particular on very steep slopes.
Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Be careful, many rocks hidden by fresh snow. The fresh wind slabs are small and in some cases prone to triggering.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER

snowpackStructure.comment:
20 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last seven days. The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2200 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. On steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m a little snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is now lying.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in all aspects.

tendency.highlights: As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the natural activity of small moist avalanches will increase.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The wind slabs of Wednesday remain in some cases prone to triggering. The fresh snow of the last five days as well as the wind slabs can still be released in some cases. These are covered with new snow and therefore difficult to recognise.
The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example.
To some extent avalanches can be released in deep layers and reach medium size. Whumpfing sounds serve as an alarm indicating the danger. Artificially triggered avalanches and stability tests confirm this situation. On very steep sunny slopes the likelihood of avalanches will increase during the day.
Backcountry touring and other off-piste activities call for careful route selection.
Caution is to be exercised in particular along the border with Switzerland and in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 3 (considerable). Several small to medium-sized slab avalanches have been released by people in the last few days.
On extremely steep sunny slopes small and medium-sized dry and moist snow slides are to be expected from the middle of the day, in particular at the base of rock walls, and in steep rocky terrain.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh and older wind slabs represent the main danger. Weak layers in the old snowpack necessitate caution.

snowpackStructure.comment:
30 to 50 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last seven days. The strong wind has transported the new snow. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in all aspects.
At low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.

tendency.highlights: As the day progresses as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation there will be a gradual increase in the danger of moist snow slides.
